isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CLUTCH CONTROL LINKAGE - 9800 SERIES - REPLACE - RELAY LEVER BUSHING

step1.para: Remove the radiator grille upper panel, the headlamp bezels and the radiator grille lower panel.

caution.para: Before fully tilting the cab, be sure that the area in front of the cab is clear of anything that would cause damage to the cab when it is fully tilted.

step1.para: Disconnect the control rod return spring.
Disconnect the upper (vertical) and lower (horizontal) control rods from the relay lever by removing the cotter and yoke pins (Items 2 and 8, Figure 6.
Inspect the yoke pin holes in the upper and lower control rods. If worn, replace the rods.
Remove the cotter pin. Remove the relay pivot bolt, retaining nut and flat washer.
Remove the relay lever, sleeve and pivot bolt from the cab hinge bracket ( Figure 6).
Inspect the yoke pin holes in the relay lever. If worn, replace the relay lever.
Use a remover tool and support plate ( Figure 7) to press the old bushing from the relay lever. Remover tool can be made locally following dimensions shown in Figure 8.
Install the new bushing in the relay lever as follows:

step2.para: Lubricate the bore of the relay lever and the outside diameter of the bushing with engine oil.
Start the bushing into the chamfered side of the relay shaft bore.
Support the relay lever on a flat surface. Use a driver tool and tool handle ZTSE-2635 ( Figure 9) to press the bushing into relay lever until flush with the edges of the lever.
Check the fit of the new pivot sleeve in the bushing. If necessary, lightly hone the bushing to obtain .002 to .006" (.05 to .15 mm) running clearance.

step1.para: Position the pivot bolt, pivot sleeve and relay lever on the cab hinge bracket. Install the flat washer and slotted nut ( Figure 6).
Tighten the relay lever retaining nut to 50 to 60 ft-lbs. (68 to 81 N•m). Install cotter pin. (If necessary, turn the nut slightly to align cotter pin slots with the pin hole in the bolt).
Connect the upper and lower control rods to the relay lever with yoke pins. Install new cotter pins.

important.para: The yoke pins must be installed so that the end with the cotter pin hole points outward (toward driver's side of vehicle).

step1.para:
Check the clutch internal, clutch pedal and release yoke to release bearing clearance adjustments and readjust if needed. Refer to ADJUSTMENT
.
